required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of SHR-1209 Combined With Lipid-lowering Agents in Patients With Hypercholesterolemia and Hyperlipidemia
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentre, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Phase III Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of SHR-1209 Combined With Lipid-lowering Agents in the Stable Treatment of Patients With Hypercholesterolemia and Hyperlipidemia .

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the efficacy, safety, pharmacokinetics and immunogenicity of SHR-1209 subcutaneous administration in patients with hypercholesterolemia and hyperlipidemia after lipid-lowering therapy

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage change in LDL-C relative to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: The value of changes in LDL-C relative to baseline
blood pressure with the unit of mm Hg
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 56 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: body temperature with the unit of °C
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 56 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: pulse rate with the unit of beats per minute
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 56 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Breathe with the unit of beats per minunt
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 56 weeks
through study completion, an average of 56 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: injection reactions, the investigators through check up the skin of abdomen
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 56 weeks
